t: Jeremiah 10
A Satire on Idolatry
Hear*p the word which the Lord*s speaks to you, O house of Israel.
Thus says the Lord,*s “Do*pn not learn the way of the nations, And*ln do not be terrified by the signs of the heavens Although*ln the nations are terrified by them;
For*ln the customs of the peoples are delusion; Because*ln it is wood cut from the forest, The*ln work of the hands of a craftsman with a cutting tool.
They*ln decorate it*i with silver and with gold; They*ln fasten it with nails and with hammers So*ln that it will not totter.

Like*ln a scarecrow in a cucumber field are they, And*ln they cannot speak; They*ln must be carried, Because*ln they cannot walk! Do*ln not fear them, For*ln they can do no harm, Nor*ln can they do any good.”
There*ln is none like You, O Lord;*s You*ln are great, and great is Your name in might.
Who*ln would not fear You, O King of the nations? Indeed*ln it is Your due! For*ln among all the wise men of the nations And*ln in all their kingdoms, There*ln is none like You.
But*ln they are altogether stupid and foolish In*iln their*i discipline of delusion—their idol is wood!

Beaten*ln silver is brought from Tarshish, And*ln gold from Uphaz, The*ln work of a craftsman and of the hands of a goldsmith; Violet*ln and purple are their clothing; They*ln are all the work of skilled men.
But*ln the Lord*s is the true God; He*ln is the living God and the everlasting King. At*ln His wrath the earth quakes, And*ln the nations cannot endure His indignation.
Thus*p you shall say to them, “The gods that did not make the heavens and the earth will perish from the earth and from under the heavens.”
It*ipn is*i He who made the earth by His power, Who*ln established the world by His wisdom; And*ln by His understanding He has stretched out the heavens.

When*ln He utters His voice, there*i is*i a tumult of waters in the heavens, And*ln He causes the clouds to ascend from the end of the earth; He*ln makes lightning for the rain, And*ln brings out the wind from His storehouses.
Every*ln man is stupid, devoid of knowledge; Every*ln goldsmith is put to shame by his idols; For*ln his molten images are deceitful, And*ln there is no breath in them.
They*ln are worthless, a work of mockery; In*ln the time of their punishment they will perish.
The*ln portion of Jacob is not like these; For*ln the Maker of all is He, And*ln Israel is the tribe of His inheritance; The*ln Lord*s of hosts is His name.
Pick*ln up your bundle from the ground, You*ln who dwell under siege!
For*ln thus says the Lord,*s “Behold,*ln I am slinging out the inhabitants of the land At*ln this time, And*ln will cause them distress, That*ln they may be found.”
Woe*ln is me, because of my injury! My*ln wound is incurable. But*ln I said, “Truly this is a sickness, And*ln I must bear it.”
My*ln tent is destroyed, And*ln all my ropes are broken; My*ln sons have gone from me and are no more. There*ln is no one to stretch out my tent again Or*ln to set up my curtains.
For*ln the shepherds have become stupid And*ln have not sought the Lord;*s Therefore*ln they have not prospered, And*ln all their flock is scattered.
The*ln sound of a report! Behold, it comes— A*ln great commotion out of the land of the north— To*ln make the cities of Judah A*ln desolation, a haunt of jackals.
I*ln know, O Lord,*s that a man’s way is not in himself, Nor*ln is it in a man who walks to direct his steps.
Correct*ln me, O Lord,*s but with justice; Not*ln with Your anger, or You will bring me to nothing.

Pour*ln out Your wrath on the nations that do not know You And*ln on the families that do not call Your name; For*ln they have devoured Jacob; They*ln have devoured him and consumed him And*ln have laid waste his habitation.
